page.title: 01AROUND WELLINGTON
page.content: The area is the broad valley of the River Lugg which runs North/South with wooded hills to the N & W and Hereford to the S. The word "marsh" appears in several local names and the land adjoining the river is used mainly for pasture and grazing cattle and sheep. There are few roads running across the valley. Both the main Hereford/Leominster road, A49, and the main railway line from Hereford to Shrewesbury run North/South to the west of the river. Threes are sparse with very few orchards and land is used mainly for pasture or growing grops (eg. corn). Wellington is the main settlement but with little evidense of local industry. A large military camp (one square kilometre) lies between the main road and railway and is accessible from both. It appears deserted. No military housing
